name: Ambrosia
description: "Do you need an enthusiastic walking partner who looks like a million dollars on the other end of the leash?  Meet Ambrosia.  After she’s gotten some of her energy out, she enjoys training games that provide mental and physical enrichment.  She’s not a big snuggler — don’t take it personally, but she does enjoy being brushed and massaged when she’s in the right mood.  We’re looking for a very dog-savvy adopter with consistency and above average dog-training ability.  Does this sound like you?  Please call us.  Ambrosia needs a real home — she has been patiently waiting for you for way too long."

name: Daisy
description: "Daisy, our tennis ball-chasing, hurdle-jumping, athletic girl, finally found her perfect family almost two years after she was first brought to PIN. She found a home with humans who had experience training active, teachable dogs like her. And she is fitting right in and even has her own couch. Her family says, "We absolutely love having her!!""

name: Obie
description: "Although Obie had a few reactivity issues, he was very affectionate and loving with those he knew well. After a 10-month stay at our shelter and many hours working with our behavior team, Obie was finally adopted! He quickly made himself right at home with his new family and is very happy."

name: Caliber
description: "After 364 days at our shelter, Caliber was finally adopted by a couple who fell head over heels for him. He now goes by Cal and is adored by his family."

name: Skippy
description: "The heterochromatic young man you see here is none other than the loving and energetic Skippy. Now, we know the word "energetic" might turn potential adopters away, but we have a solution! One of Skippy's fave activities is heading out to the yard and trying to fetch as many tennis balls as he can in 20 minutes. He's always trying to break his personal record and that will tire him out pretty quickly. After fetch, he will gratefully snuggle on the couch with his humans. If reading this piqued your interest in learning more about Skippy, come on down to our Redwood City location!"

name: Larry
description: "Larry came to PIN as a shy and fearful puppy. With the help of our behavior team, Larry gained confidence in noisy and busy environments, learned to play with other dogs, and began to trust humans. He found his home after 6 months with us. Larry is now known as Dexter, is bonding with his doggy brother, and is admired and adored by his family."

name: Catelyn
description: "Many animals don't thrive in the shelter environment and Catelyn was one of them. The noise, strangers, and living next door to other cats all made Catelyn pretty cranky. Luckily, a woman came by the shelter looking to see if she can help an unfriendly cat blossom. She took Catelyn home as a foster, fell in love, and couldn't bear the thought of having to bring Catelyn back to the shelter. The woman ended up adopting Catelyn and renamed her to Noodle. Noodle is now a happy, affectionate cat who got the loving family she deserved."

name: Hope
description: "Hope was another one of our residents who didn't thrive in the hustle and bustle of the shelter environment. Fortunately, her adopters discovered her through our youth programs and were determined to adopt her because of her unfriendly personality! Hope now lives with that family in a lovely home on the coast. She has her own room with a queen-sized bed to sprawl out on and is loved dearly."

name: Donica
prev_location: Humane Society of the North Bay
description: "Like all of us humans, there is only so much social interaction we can take before we start to feel—well—grumpy. For Donica, once she became overstimulated, she would communicate her feelings with a nip at the hand closest to her. We quickly realized that Donica is the not the right fit for families looking for a cuddly cat. Because families who are looking for a withdrawn housemate are few and far between, placing Donica in a home was a challenge. By a stroke of luck, at the start of 2019, a couple visited our shelter, met Donica, and decided she would be a great addition to their family. And so, after 286 days at our shelter, Donica finally got her happy adoption story."

name: Kitty
description: "Being an older cat and not the most affectionate, Kitty was often overlooked by our visitors. One day, a local veterinarian came in and asked to meet our oldest cat and longest resident. The prospective adopter just spent a short time with Kitty before ultimately deciding to take her home. It turned out to be the perfect match! Kitty adapted quickly to her new home, enjoys playing with her toys, and frequently solicits cuddles from her adopter. Her adopter says, "Kitty has been an amazing addition to my home and to my heart, and my only wish is that I had come to adopt her sooner!""

name: Zeus
description: "Unlike many of our long-stay residents, Zeus didn't have any behavior issues that would hinder his search for a home. Our staff observed him as an easy-to-adopt dog who was overlooked because of his looks. As a bald, grey chihuahhua, he didn't capture the attention of adopters who were in search for fluffy, cuddly-looking dogs. He also didn't seem to be the most chummy guy, rarely approaching humans and only tolerating other dogs. Fortunately, after 6 months in our shelter, Zeus found a family who accepted him just as he is. Since then, he has proved to be a very affectionate member of the household, hopping up onto laps and giving plenty of kisses!"

name: Dutchess
description:
"Introvert seeks same.

When she first arrived at our shelter, Duchess wouldn’t let anyone touch her.  It was hiding, hiding, and more hiding.  After a lot of patience and perseverance from our volunteers, this shy girl is finally coming out of her shell.  Go kitty go!  

Although no one would ever mistake her for an extrovert, Dutchess is now accepting petting and lap time from her human friends.  The formula for success is simple: go slow, introduce yourself, and let her sniff your hand first. 

Do you have room in your heart and home for this shy, sensitive soul?  We would love to introduce you to Dutchess."

name: Ryley
description: "Honestly, we don't know why it took so long for Ryley to get adopted. While she was at our shelter, she would always ask for attention by cozying up to humans, mooching for snacks, and chasing toys around her room. It was probably one of those cases of our visitors not pausing to notice everything that makes Ryley fantastic. Luckily, one of our February visitors did notice and took Ryley home. About a week after the adoption, had this to say about Ryley's affection level: "Never had a cat so aggressive about getting love—she's almost x-rated.""

name: Cora
description:
"This calico queen is devastatingly beautiful, but — and there’s really no nice way to say this — she doesn’t suffer fools gladly.  She likes people, she likes playing, and she likes sitting in laps…up to a point.  After that, prepare to be put in your place, human.

Here’s an interesting thing about cats who are cranky in the shelter: sometimes they’re just unhappy here.  When they get a home of their own, they usually settle in and become total marshmallows immediately.  We’ve seen it so many times.  Are you a cat-savvy person with room in your heart for Cora?  We hope so."

name: Metro
description: "Meet Metro! This adorable face is mostly Pibble but could have a touch of Frenchie thrown in. Have you seen those ears?! This guy is the right mix of spunky, playful and adorable. He loves going on walks but will also never turn down a rousing game of fetch- he loves toys of every shape and size. While he has a few basic cues down, his skills do need a little refining but have no fear- he will happily be a teacher's pet and star of his class. Metro is a quick learner and he’s looking for a dog-savvy handler who is ready to do some training. With Metro, the rewards will be endless. He’s a love bug and a goofball!"
